definition: to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: After hacker attack website is procurable, carry out " hang a horse " .
sentences.chinese: 當黑客攻擊網站得手後，便實施“掛馬”。

sentences.english: When you want something and cannot get it you become frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 當你想要一些東西卻無法得手時，你變得失落。

sentences.english: Hopefully, a victim will report the card as missing before the attacker gets that far.
sentences.chinese: 希望受害者能在攻擊者得手之前報告信用卡丟失。

sentences.english: And we won't let them get away with it.
sentences.chinese: 而我們不會讓他們輕易得手。

sentences.english: He hit his first shot of the fourth quarter before a 19 -footer rimmed out.
sentences.chinese: 接着第四節開始後又再19英尺處跳射得手。

sentences.english: To win the respect of rival, is after appropriate point heat to the losers.
sentences.chinese: 贏得對手的尊重，就是得手後適當的反點彩頭給輸家。

sentences.english: Several bounty hunters almost succeeded in collecting during run-ins on Ord Mantell.
sentences.chinese: 幾個賞金獵人在曼特爾兵站與漢遭遇，差點得手。

sentences.english: Zhao Yang with a high stick to the city deep pool, so that's difficult to succeed Moses.
sentences.chinese: 趙憑藉晉陽高城深池固守，使智氏難以得手。

sentences.english: The work went on quite smoothly.
If two players go for a ball the one who jumps first will win it.
sentences.chinese: 兩個球員搶點，誰先跳往往得手。

sentences.english: If you are too easy-to-get, men will find you boring.
sentences.chinese: 如果太容易得手，男人會覺得你很無趣。

sentences.english: Mihm passed back to Sun for a 16-foot jumper.
sentences.chinese: 米姆把球回傳給孫悅，孫悅16尺中投得手。

sentences.english: Crowded shops are a happy hunting-ground for pick-pockets.
sentences.chinese: 擁擠不堪的商店是扒手行竊最得手的地方。

sentences.english: Her hands, which she had wet in drawing the water, felt cold;
sentences.chinese: 她開始感得手冷，那是先頭在取水時弄溼的。

sentences.english: On top of success in his business, his wife has borne him a chubby boy baby.
sentences.chinese: 除了生意上得手以外，他妻子還給他生了個胖小子。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to return a compliment/to give sth in return
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to collude with/to collaborate/(basketball) hook shot
to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
